intro: Abies pinsapo subsp. pinsapo, commonly known as the Iberian fir, is a rare and relict species native to the Sierra de Cazorla in southern Spain. It is a coniferous evergreen tree with needle-like leaves and conical crowns, typically growing in mountainous regions. The tree has distinctive bark that is reddish-brown and fissured, and its cones are pendulous, containing winged seeds. It is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its native habitat and is considered a relict species due to its limited distribution. Due to habitat loss and climate change, it is classified as critically endangered by the IUCN.
